articles.headline: Investment Places F.C.C. Aide Amid Fraud Inquiry
articles.snippet: Lenders have questioned an official’s investment in what turned out to be a fraudulent venture that took more than $54 million from shareholders.
articles.abstract: Lenders have questioned an official’s investment in what turned out to be a fraudulent venture that took more than $54 million from shareholders.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  For the last three years, Daniel Gonzalez has been the loyal lieutenant and gatekeeper to Kevin J. Martin, the chairman of the Federal Communications Commission. He has kept the agency humming, the paper flowing and the staff vacancies filled as Mr. Martin’s chief of staff.

articles.headline: Cell Services Keep It Easy, and Free
articles.snippet: Several super-simple cellular services are so sweet and satisfying, you can’t believe they’re free.
articles.abstract: Several super-simple cellular services are so sweet and satisfying, you can’t believe they’re free.
articles.lead_paragraph: You hear it all the time: “These cellphones are too complicated, by cracky! I don’t want to play music or surf the Internet. I just want to make phone calls!”

articles.headline: Wal-Mart’s Detractors Come In From the Cold
articles.snippet: After waging an aggressive public relations campaign against Wal-Mart for three years, the company’s union-backed critics are lowering their pitchforks.
articles.abstract: After waging an aggressive public relations campaign against Wal-Mart for three years, the company’s union-backed critics are lowering their pitchforks.
articles.lead_paragraph: Over the last several months, a confidential report has circulated within the headquarters of Wal-Mart Stores, proposing sweeping changes to its employee health care plans.

articles.headline: Food Is Gold, So Billions Invested in Farming
articles.snippet: Some private investors are starting to make long-term bets that the world’s need for food will increase.
articles.abstract: Some private investors are starting to make long-term bets that the world’s need for food will increase.
articles.lead_paragraph: Huge investment funds have already poured hundreds of billions of dollars into booming financial markets for commodities like wheat, corn and soybeans.

articles.headline: Opposition to Menthol Cigarettes Grows
articles.snippet: Seven former health secretaries protested menthol’s special treatment in a tobacco bill pending in Congress.
articles.abstract: Seven former health secretaries protested menthol’s special treatment in a tobacco bill pending in Congress.
articles.lead_paragraph: Seven former federal health secretaries joined on Wednesday to protest menthol’s special treatment in a tobacco bill pending in Congress.

articles.headline: Awaiting Clinton’s Return to Home on Old House Lane
articles.snippet: After Tuesday night, it’s probably clear to everyone, even the residents of 15 Old House Lane, that the next president will come from someplace other than Chappaqua, N.Y.
articles.abstract: After Tuesday night, it’s probably clear to everyone, even the residents of 15 Old House Lane, that the next president will come from someplace other than Chappaqua, N.Y.

articles.headline: At Harvard, They Hail a Fed Chief
articles.snippet: Ben S. Bernanke spoke about the economic pressures created by high oil prices and inflation at his alma mater.
articles.abstract: Ben S. Bernanke spoke about the economic pressures created by high oil prices and inflation at his alma mater.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  Ben S. Bernanke spoke about the economic pressures created by high oil prices and inflation at his alma mater on Wednesday.

articles.headline: A City Where Hospitals Are as Ill as the Patients
articles.snippet: Since a large hospital closed last summer, thousands of people in South Los Angeles have scrambled for care.
articles.abstract: Since a large hospital closed last summer, thousands of people in South Los Angeles have scrambled for care.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  The patients line up at 6:30 a.m. outside the tidy clinic. Two hours later, when it opens, they will sit and wait some more.

articles.headline: Clinton Ready to End Bid and Endorse Obama
articles.snippet: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton will bring to a close her 17-month campaign for the White House after Democrats urged her to allow the party to unite.
articles.abstract: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton will bring to a close her 17-month campaign for the White House after Democrats urged her to allow the party to unite.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton will endorse Senator Barack Obama on Saturday, bringing a close to her 17-month campaign for the White House, aides said. Her decision came after Democrats urged her Wednesday to leave the race and allow the party to coalesce around Mr. Obama.
articles.byline: By Adam Nagourney and Jeff Zeleny

articles.headline: Many Blacks Find Joy in Unexpected Breakthrough
articles.snippet: Many African-Americans exulted in a triumph that they believed they would never live to see, hoping their children would draw strength from the moment.
articles.abstract: Many African-Americans exulted in a triumph that they believed they would never live to see, hoping their children would draw strength from the moment.
articles.lead_paragraph: Kwabena Sam-Brew, a 38-year-old immigrant from Ghana, doubted that Nana, his 5-year-old American-born daughter, would remember the rally that effectively crowned Senator Barack Obama as the Democratic nominee Tuesday night.

articles.headline: Verizon in Talks to Buy Alltel
articles.snippet: The potential $27 billion deal would create the nation’s largest cellular telephone provider.
articles.abstract: The potential $27 billion deal would create the nation’s largest cellular telephone provider.
articles.lead_paragraph: Verizon Communications is near a deal to buy Alltel for about $27 billion, including the assumption of debt. Vodafone, Verizon’s partner in its wireless business, confirmed the talks in a short statement Thursday, which said Verizon Wireless was in “advanced discussions regarding the potential acquisition of Alltel.”
articles.byline: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Laura M. Holson

articles.headline: For Clinton, a Key Group Didn’t Hold
articles.snippet: The break in Hillary Rodham Clinton’s supposed firewall of superdelegates turned out to be one of the most important factors in her campaign.
articles.abstract: The break in Hillary Rodham Clinton’s supposed firewall of superdelegates turned out to be one of the most important factors in her campaign.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article was reported by Julie Bosman, Larry Rohter and Katharine Q. Seelye and was written by Ms. Seelye.
